exceptions.tactic: destruct list_pick with (X:=bool) (ll:=lb) (k:=1) as [[z [l1 [l2 [H1 H2]]]]|[H1 H2]].
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 2 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
lb: list bool

Goal:
({k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat One k})%type

Premises:
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Notation One := true
tl : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation Zero := false
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
list_bool_choose : forall lb : list bool, {k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat Zero k}
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = nil}
bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe2
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lH -> forall lmp : list (bool * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol bool), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) bool_eq (triv_div Zero One bool_eq) lH = lmp ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) Zero One bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
list_repeat_plus : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (a b : nat), list_repeat x (a + b) = list_repeat x a ++ list_repeat x b
ssrbool.is_inl = fun (A B : Type) (u : A + B) => match u with | inl _ => One | inr _ => Zero end : forall A B : Type, A + B -> bool Arguments ssrbool.is_inl {A B}%type_scope
BoolTheory = {| Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then One else Zero) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb One b = xorb b One) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb Zero b = xorb b Zero) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb One (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb One b) z) then fun z : bool => if z as b return (xorb One (xorb One b) = xorb (xorb One One) b) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun...
pow2_2n1_dec : forall n : nat, {p : nat & {b : nat | S n = pow2 p * (2 * b + 1)}}
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0 = n}
div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat * bool := match n with | 0 => (0, Zero) | 1 => (0, One) | S (S n1) => let (p, b) := div2 n1 in (S p, b) end : nat -> nat * bool Arguments div2 _%nat_scope
map_cst_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (y : Y) (ll : list X), map (fun _ : X => y) ll = list_repeat y (length ll)
map_duplicate_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (l' : list Y) (y1 : Y) (m' : list Y) (y2 : Y) (r' : list Y), map f ll = l' ++ y1 :: m' ++ y2 :: r' -> {l : list X & {x1 : X & {m : list X & {x2 : X & {r : list X | l' = map f l /\ y1 = f x1 /\ m' = map f m /\ y2 = f x2 /\ r' = map f r /\ ll = l ++ x1 :: m ++ x2 :: r}}}}}
list_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x : X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ x :: r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ x :: r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ x :: m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
map_list_repeat : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (x : X) (n : nat), map f (list_repeat x n) = list_repeat (f x) n
ssrbool.is_true_true = eq_refl : is_true One
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
list_cons_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x y : X), x :: r1 = l2 ++ y :: r2 -> (l2 = nil /\ x = y /\ r1 = r2) + {m : list X | l2 = x :: m /\ r1 = m ++ y :: r2}
bool_eq_ok : forall b1 b2 : bool, bool_eq b1 b2 = One -> b1 = b2
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> nil -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ a :: nil}}
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : ?p < ?n, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (fun i : nat => i < ?n) ?p h where ?p : [lb : list bool |- nat] ?n : [lb : list bool |- nat]
pow2 = fix pow2 (p : nat) : nat := match p with | 0 => 1 | S p0 => 2 * pow2 p0 end : nat -> nat Arguments pow2 _%nat_scope
list_app_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
list_choose_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall ll : list X, {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}} + {forall x : X, In x ll -> ~ P x}
Wf_Z.Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> {n : nat | x = BinInt.Z.of_nat n}
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound : forall (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof), ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker f w = One -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv BinNums.Z, Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
list_first_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall (a : X) (ll : list X), P a -> In a ll -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}}
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
bounded_search : forall (m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (forall n : nat, n < m -> P n + (P n -> False)) -> {n : nat & ((n < m) * P n)%type} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> P n -> False}
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = One
Fin.to_nat = fix to_nat (m : nat) (n : Fin.t m) {struct n} : {i : nat | i < m} := match n in (Fin.t n0) return {i : nat | i < n0} with | @Fin.F1 j => exist (fun i : nat => i < S j) 0 (Nat.lt_0_succ j) | @Fin.FS n0 p => let (i, P) := to_nat n0 p in exist (fun i0 : nat => i0 < S n0) (S i) (lt_n_S i n0 P) end : forall m : nat, Fin.t m -> {i : nat | i < m} Arguments Fin.to_nat {m}%nat_scope
min_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists n : nat, P n) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, P x -> m <= x)}
first_which : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> (exists x : nat, P x) -> {m : nat | P m /\ (forall x : nat, x < m -> ~ P x)}
flat_map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> list Y) (l : list X) (r1 : list Y) (y : Y) (r2 : list Y), flat_map f l = r1 ++ y :: r2 -> exists (l1 : list X) (m1 : list Y) (x : X) (m2 : list Y) (l2 : list X), l = l1 ++ x :: l2 /\ f x = m1 ++ y :: m2 /\ r1 = flat_map f l1 ++ m1 /\ r2 = m2 ++ flat_map f l2
BinIntDef.Z.to_nat = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Zpos p => BinPos.Pos.to_nat p | _ => 0 end : BinNums.Z -> nat Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_nat _%Z_scope
Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m1 m2 : list Y), Forall2 R l (m1 ++ m2) -> {l1 : list X & {l2 : list X | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ l = l1 ++ l2}}

destruct list_pick with (X:=bool) (ll:=lb) (k:=1) as [[z [l1 [l2 [H1 H2]]]]|[H1 H2]].
- left. exists z. exists l1. rewrite H1. auto.
- right. exists 1. rewrite H1. auto.
